Docs.summary: Describes a delegated transaction for an existing transaction that can be escalated to be managed by the MSDTC when needed.

remarks.format: ## Remarks When you want to implement a resource manager, you should not implement the <xref:System.Transactions.ITransactionPromoter> interface directly. Instead, you should implement the <xref:System.Transactions.ISinglePhaseNotification> interface, which inherits the single <xref:System.Transactions.ITransactionPromoter.Promote%2A> method of this interface. For more information on implementing a resource manager, see [Implementing A Resource Manager](~/docs/framework/data/transactions/implementing-a-resource-manager.md).

remarks.format: ## Remarks A <xref:System.Transactions.TransactionPromotionException> should be thrown by an implementation of <xref:System.Transactions.IPromotableSinglePhaseNotification> interface to indicate that a call to <xref:System.Transactions.ITransactionPromoter.Promote%2A> has failed.
